result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marquon Jamar Hutchins

records.addlTxt:
3:34 PM Defendant Marquon Jamar Hutchins appeared by video.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii appeared by video for Marquon Jamar Hutchins.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer M. Abdulghani. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marquon Jamar Hutchins not in court.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Marquon Jamar Hutchins.  Attorney Patrick Franken appeared in court on behalf of Jon R Josephsen Jr. for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for State V Lee Hearing. Court waives defendant's appearance for the purpose of today's hearing. Court advises parties that although today was calendared for a State V Lee hearing, SPD office has appointed successor counsel. Court sets next court date for a preliminary hearing before prelim court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9.16.22
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9.16.22
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Defendant Marquon Jamar Hutchins appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter from SPD regarding appointment of counsel, filed

Defendant Marquon Jamar Hutchins in court.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  bm

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Marquon Jamar Hutchins in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Marquon Jamar Hutchins in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marquon Jamar Hutchins appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in room 503 of the courthouse.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
